fields.description: Content Properties are implemented as a RequiredKeyBean, when they don't really have a key in the same way as other Connect modules. They use individual propertyKeys instead. The normal module key shows up in the field documentation, but not in the example, and as far as I know i've not used the key field before. Should we change the implementation to be a NamedBean instead?
fields.summary: Should the Content Property module be implemented as a NamedBean?
CLONE - Deleting attachment via REST API

fields.description:
To avoid the page format changing and the generic loading screen we should allow dynamic macros to customise or provide an image place holder.

At a minimum:
* allow an add-on to change the "Loading.." message
* allow an add-on to provide the loading size
* allow an add-on to provide a loading image (similar to the way iOS developers can provide a loading image, or "splashscreen", while their application is starting)
fields.summary: Macro loading placeholder

fields.description:
Context:

{noformat}
[Feb-5 6:05 PM] Patrick Streule: @MJensen and @TimPettersen What occurred to me the other day is that there is a 'multiple' option for macro parameters. I'll check how these are handled now with variable substitution. There might be some additional work needed.
[Feb-5 6:09 PM] Tim Pettersen: @PatrickStreule I think we should be ok, the Macro interface provided by Confluence is passed parameters as Map<String,String>, so collections must be in some kind of serialized form
[Feb-5 6:09 PM] Patrick Streule: Ok, cool
[Feb-5 6:09 PM] Tim Pettersen: but absolutely_ worth testing
[Feb-5 6:10 PM] Patrick Streule: yep, will do that
[Feb-5 6:12 PM] Tim Pettersen: and probably worth documenting the behavior of collection parameters (and their serialization format) so that devs know what to expect
[Feb-5 6:12 PM] Patrick Streule: totally agree
[Feb-5 6:12 PM] Tim Pettersen: I'll raise an issue
[Feb-5 6:13 PM] Tim Pettersen: @ACBot jira Document serialization format of macro parameters with "multiple"=true
{noformat}
fields.summary: Document serialization format of macro parameters with "multiple"=true

fields.description:
Slow outgoing HTTP requests to add-ons may have a performance impact, potentially causing resource exhausting and/or compromising the stability of the system. Webhooks have throttling in place, but remote conditions and remote macros may cause problems.

This could happen accidentally if an add-on is unstable or under load, or deliberately as a DoS attack.
fields.summary: Investigate performance impact of slow static content macros
Expose page search endpoints to public

fields.description:
Dynamic Content Macros are do not have the @RequiresFormat annotation specified.

In theory this would mean that dynamic macros that use a rich-text body would not be able to collect it from confluence (using the hash method).

In practice we have not seen this in production as there no public addons with this type of macro.

Will probably be made redundant when CE-52 is released.
fields.summary: Investigate Dynamic Macros with Rich Text body

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm asking here because it seems that Customer support isn't able to help me out with this one (CSP-134116). I also asked here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10392267/rest-api-authentication-not-working-with-com.pixelpark.seraph.ssoauthenticator

It seems that your bundled com.pixelpark.seraph.SSOAuthenticator does not support HTTP basic authentication for REST access. Anonymous access is possible and I get expected JSON responses, but as soon as I use Basic Auth I get no response with no obvious error in the logs or elsewhere (HTTP 200 OK with zero content body).

Can you confirm that behavior? If so, what would be a workaround? Is there a way to route REST requests to the default Confluence Authenticator (maybe via separate seraph config)?

Best regards,
Roman
fields.summary: Confluence 5.5: REST Basic Authentication not working with SSOAuthenticator

fields.description:
(Copied from an email)

We have a Salesforce connector for Confluence Cloud. It's really beneficial for Confluence users to see more context of any Salesforce objects (URLs) discussed on a particular Confluence page, without actually leaving Confluence. For example, when a user clicks on the link in the macro (view mode) we would like to show more details of the Salesforce object. (screenshot attached)

Now, showing a dialog would interrupt the page view and overlay the content. We were thinking if it's possible to utilise any component like inline comments, so we can show the details of Salesforce objects on the side instead (screenshot attached).

Would this be possible? I would appreciate any suggestion.
fields.summary: Add an inline dialog extension point for macros

fields.description:
As per spec: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/2646376451/Spec+Embedded+content+api

Confluence renders the latest version of embedded content (eg attachment) by default.

This new feature allows vendor to specify the rendering mode on content conversion api.
The embeddedContentRender parameter can be set to either live or historical.
When it was specified to historical the embedded will be rendered using the version at the time of save.
fields.summary: Render embedded content with saved version

fields.description: Enable connect on Confluence mobile so connect addons can render macros and other extensions in the mobile client.
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile support for Connect Macros

fields.description:
Currently embedded content does not track which version of a piece of an embedded content is shown when viewing a previous version of a page. Thing like images, view files macro and include page macros should track which version of content is present at the time of "save"
This would fix a core problem in confluences versioning, possibly just involves adding an attribute to storage format for resource identifiers.

[Spec link|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CP/Spec%3A+Embedded+content+api]
fields.summary: Embedded content version tracking

fields.description:
You can currently access the Page Properties Report data in JSON format using the "masterdetail" REST API as follows:

/rest/masterdetail/1.0/detailssummary.json (with appropriate parameters)

However, this API is not currently in scope for AC.

The use case is to provide the ability to create add-ons that create custom reports and additional report filters of Page Properties data. The current work around is to extract the data from a Page Properties Report macro in a page, however for large sets of pages (e.g. 5,000+ pages) this could be inefficient to process or potentially have a performance impact on the Confluence instance. The "masterdetail" API support pageSize and pageIndex parameters, so at least the data could be batched.

Also see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31081
fields.summary: Add the Page Properties Report "masterdetail" REST API to the AC scope

fields.description:
We are developing a (new) Connect version of our (current) P2 Confluence plugin.

We are now facing the challenge of "migrating" the (current) P2 macro.

One possible solution would be to "replace" the (current) P2 macro into the (new) Connect macro format. 

In this way, when the (current) P2 plugin will be uninstalled, the users will not have to manually "fix" each wiki page deleting the P2 macro and recreating a (new) Connect macro. 

Is there a suggested way to 'convert' a P2 macro into a Connect format?

*OLD MACRO FORMAT*

{code:xml}
<ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="c9346465-2981-467b-841a-909703683ba0" ac:name="mockup" ac:schema-version="1">
   <ac:parameter ac:name="Alignment">Left</ac:parameter>
   <ac:parameter ac:name="Version">1</ac:parameter>
   <ac:parameter ac:name="Width">600</ac:parameter>
   <ac:parameter ac:name="Name">P2-Balsamiq</ac:parameter>
   <ac:parameter ac:name="" />
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

*NEW MACRO FORMAT*

{code:xml}
<ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="8d472368-defd-4d9f-a58c-97a0de0aa2d3" ac:name="dynamic-balsamiq-macro-v2" ac:schema-version="1">
   <ac:parameter ac:name="data">
   {
       "name": "P2-Balsamiq",
       "width": "600",
       "alignment: "Left",
       "version": "1"
   }
   </ac:parameter>
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

*Unescaped json object contained in the <ac:parameter ac:name="data">*

{code:none}
{
   "name": "P2-Balsamiq",
   "width": "600",
   "alignment: "Left",
   "version": "1"
}
 
{code}
fields.summary: Convert P2 macro into dynamic Connect macro

If mutiple bars or lanes(over about 30) are inserted into Roadmap planner macro, 
http status code 400 bad request of javascript occurs with the entry point which created the placeholder (http://example.com/plugins/servlet/confluence/placeholder/macro-heading).
We've raised the bug report [CONF-37543 "Placeholder of Roadmap planner macro is disappeared due to 404 error of Javascript."|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-37543].

We assume that the process which created the placeholder causes this error.
To fix this, do you have any idea which can reduce this processing load?
fields.summary: Reduce processing load when creating the placeholder of Roadmap Planner macros.

The new version include a new servlet API that will help us to collect licensing information useful for the migration to the new Connect version of the add-on ([~dparrish] and [~bwoskow] are following all the details).

Update the Connect documentation to reflect this.

fields.description:
h3. The problem: 
Say you set a content property on a confluence page, to fulfil a condition about what web items should show on that page. Because content properties are versioned in step with page versions, when you then view an old version of that page, it won't find anything and the web item won't show up. In theory, you'd need to save the content property on every version of the page that was created, in order to be able to use conditions with other page versions.

h3. Current Proposed Solution:
This tracks adding a new enum parameter to the definition of a condition, called {{propertyResolver}}. It would allow the add-on to say it wanted to check the current version of the page as well as the page being looked at for any relevant properties to match against.
fields.summary: Allow deep resolving of Content Property Conditions
Allow static macros be rendered with POST
Fix cloud REST API documentation build

fields.description:
Hi guys,

One of the largest customers is using our very popular Archiving Plugin for Confluence. 

They're facing a problem, and the root cause is that one of the comparator classes in the Confluence source is not "transitive". We spent numerous hours with debugging this (in Confluence and in the JDK core), and the problem only happens for collections larger than 32 items and only on certain Java versions.

Please find all details and unit test here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-45910

As you probably see our add-on is using long-running tasks, and maybe you can you give us an idea for a workaround. If this is not realistic to fix this in Confluence (where this should be fixed), a workaround on the add-on side (we don't see any, unfortunately) could help the customer with their problem.
fields.summary: Add-on workaround for the problem: Confluence crashes with "Comparison method violates its general contract!" when trying to sort multiple long-running tasks
Operations REST API

fields.description:
In AbstractContentMacroModuleProvider::createInsertTitle and createEditTitle, getText is called during installation time.  This mean I18N doesn't happen during http request, so we are properly translating text based user locality setting.  

[~rmassaioli] pointed out: Looks like this code could use the Atlassian Connect translations work that the JIRA Ecosystem team has done. We should follow up with JIRA team and find out how they handle similar case.

[~kkercz]: Krzysztof Kercz
hmm, it's the legacy path here, coming from the deprecated createPluginModuleDescriptors, so the translation mechanism doesn't apply.
But what is more important: it's our own i18n message, not one provided by the add-on. I assume getting our own translations is fast and does not entail any db calls. So just calling getText while deserializing from protobuf should suffice. Unless it would be a performance hit, in which case the other way would be to get all translations from our product when serializing to protobuf and saving them in the i18nMessage, then deserializing as usual with ConfluenceI18nStorageConverter.
fields.summary: I18N for macro custom editor title is done during plugin installation.
Rerun query to find customers purchasing bob swift between installation into the db and unbundling

fields.description:
I installed a connect add-on and the batch js was generated as:
bq. https://mjensen-dev-2.atlassian.net/wiki/s/afb7b7d2f634e8dc6b913334b34b51b6-T/en_GB/6442/8236ed2438359708601c5a846c4a7bb26987e2d9/217ecdac0e868baf179cc557936dea99

* I then made some updates and re-installed it, the batch was at the same URL (in this case the change I made was the title of the custom macro editor)
* This means the changes are not automatically refreshed in the browser.

I would have expected a new URL which would force the browser to get the updated javascript.
fields.summary: Installing Connect add-on doesn't change the resource batch

fields.description:
My use case is a remote macro that renders differently depending of the content permission (i.e. readonly vs read-write permission).

I know I can get the permissions already, however it would require calls to the confluence server, which we want to minimize. 

So I'd like to have a way to know what the user's page permissions are (e.g. {{content-can-edit}} or {{content-permissions}}, without having to make additional REST requests to minimise performance impact.
fields.summary: A confluence add-on should know the user's permissions
Introduce STR to Connect Plugin

fields.description:
When developing a plugin using AMPS, the SDK imports a data backup into Confluence. This data is versioned along with the Confluence version, but the data itself doesn't appear to have changed for years. It contains obsolete and redundant entity data as well as wiki markup content, and Confluence needs to upgrade that content each and every time.

This data set needs to be updated and sanitised, preferably automatically on each confluence release.
fields.summary: Update the confluence data imported by AMPS

fields.description: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Epic%3A+The+Connect+Macro
fields.summary: Connect Macros Phase 2

fields.description:
I asked a question on https://answers.atlassian.com last month on [Writing integration tests for Confluence using PageObjects|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24657172/writing-integration-tests-for-confluence-using-pageobjects]

Nobody answered so after some research, I decided to create a tutorial and a code sample :
https://seuqra.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ACDD/Tutorial+-+Writing+integration+tests+for+Confluence+using+PageObjects

I think such a tutorial could be included in the Confluence Developer Documentation
fields.summary: Writing integration tests for Confluence using PageObjects
add user_task events to confluence webhooks

fields.description: Multiple '{}' tokens in an autoconvert matcher pattern results in many adjacent '.*?' tokens being present in the resulting regex. This doesn't seem to slow anything down as yet, but would be nice to reduce the redundancy for potential performance reasons.
fields.summary: Autoconvert: Replace multiple adjacent wildcards with a single regex '.*?'

fields.description:
The ticket created from SAC:
The custom developed gadget for Dashboard is using Confluence.Templates.Dashboard JS package in one of custom developed add-ons Confluence 5.8.5. 
!pic3.jpg|thumbnail!
After the upgrade to Confluence 5.10.x we have noticed that this package is not available anymore.

h3. How to Replicate
# Install Confluence 5.10.4( or 5.10.8 as well)
# Login to the instance
# Open JS console in the browser and type {{Confluence.Templates.}}
!pic1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Please Help With

We haven't found any announcements that some JS APIs will be obsoleted and removed from Confluence in 5.10.
# Please confirm if it's a bug or not?
# If not then what's recommended to use instead?
fields.summary: Confluence.Templates.Dashboard is not available for

fields.description: The Connect condition entity_property_equal_to supports add-on properties and JIRA-specific entity properties, but not Confluence content properties. That entity type should be added.
fields.summary: Add support for content properties in entity_property_equal_to condition

fields.description:
Our Balsamiq Mockups plugin displays a preview of the wireframes using a macro module.

When the user wants to see the wireframe in full screen, the plugin needs to launch a full screen dialog (without chrome) and reload the Balsamiq project viewer/designer.

It would be more efficient if the macro contained in the page were allowed to go full screen.
In this way it would be not necessary to reload our designer in order to display the data.
fields.summary: Allow iframe contained in a Connect macro to go fullscreen
Custom webresource problems

fields.description: *Use case: I have embedded google presentation and not having `allowfullscreen` prevents it from to be in full screen presentation mode.*

fields.description:
Github limits API calls to 5000 requests per hour for a given OAuth key/secret pair. This is fine for a normal connect add-on, but will become an issue for when this becomes a system add-on.

Maybe Atlassian already has a relationship with Github? Maybe I can piggy back on some credentials we already use.
fields.summary: Solve rate limiting for Github API calls for bundling
Spike Full screen dialog integration

fields.description:
This is not about webhooks. 

The requests is for action in the browser, I want my iframe dialog to respond so events such as:
* Label added
* Comment added
* Page is liked

For example, I have a workflow which changes the status of a page when a label is added.

A user loads a page, the initial status is shown. Then the users adds a label. I want my iframe app to get a notification, so it know it has to reload the status.
fields.summary: As connect add-on developer, I want to receive user in-browser page action events, so my app can be responsive to them
Unbundle Appfire plugins from Confluence codebase

fields.description:
Add a data attribute for content ids in rendered links, to allow identifying the content object you are navigating to from the rendered html.

This also should work for macros rendering links such as (but not limited to):
* children
* toc
* ...
fields.summary: Add a data attribute for content ids in rendered links

fields.description:
Due to the limitations of Kibana with: 
* Joining different datasets together
* Enabling newer beta features (which we require, e.g. cumulative sums)
* Not having full control over the type of data visualisations we can do

We are opting for our own in-house ecosystem dashboard. In this first iteration, a couple of REST endpoints will be exposed to provide appropriate information regarding addons listed on Marketplace, using the Marketplace API (v2.0-beta).

fields.description:
When testing the server connection in RubyMine, with the URL: {{https://procoretech.atlassian.net/}}, and using my login (alan.stebbens@procore.com), and with the correct password, the plugin gets a strange error.  I've attached the short and long errors.

I've used this plugin before (with another company, on an earlier version of RubyMine, so I'm confident that it _should_ work, but it's not.

Perhaps this issue is related to that we're using Google Apps for our authentication?  In case that was the problem, I explicitly set my Atlassian password, but that did not help overcome the problem.

Thanks for your help
Alan

Using:
RubyMine 2016.3.1
Build #RM-163.9166.34, built on December 15, 2016
Licensed to Procore Technologies / Alan Stebbens
Subscription is active until October 5, 2017
JRE: 1.8.0_112-release-408-b6 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
fields.summary: Cannot connect from RubyMine using Atlassian Connector for ItelliJ

fields.description:
On this page there is very limited documentation for the `propertyKey` field. I found through my own playing around that having a dash in the key is illegal, but this isn't specified. Also - we should move the "NOTE: the propertyKey must be globally unique. You should prefix it with the name of your plugin to ensure its unique." statement into this part too - it's hidden in the blob of explaining text at the top of the page.

https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/content-property-index-key-configuration.html
fields.summary: Update documentation for Content Property field 'propertyKey'

fields.description:
The macro editor is implemented as a client-side override and doesn't go through the same rendering process as other connect components, which prevents it from supporting any variable substitution at the moment.

We already use a variable transformer for the injected JS, however, so it may be possible to support page-level variables (not macro-specific ones, however).

A client-side JS API to get the page context would be an alternative if variable substitution doesn't work.
fields.summary: Support content.id variable in macro editor URL

fields.description: When using the rest API to retrieve content from Confluence, if the content contains images, the image path is specified with a relative URL. e.g: {code} {code} This means the image cannot be rendered inside a Connect add-on or other Iframe. From: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-44668
fields.summary: Images are returned with a relative path from the content API
Explicitly declare mention and inline tasks' web resource

fields.description:
Expansion breaks pagination:

Adding the property {{&expand=ancestors}} to below endpoint breaks pagination:
 * [https://host/wiki/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page?limit=500&start=200]

h3. How to Replicate
 # Log into the instance and write below url in the browser address bar (or send a GET request using Curl):
 ** [https://host/wiki/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page?limit=500&start=200]
 # See that 283 results are returned and there is no link to the next page of results since the number of results is lower than the limit we have set (this is just working as documented):
{noformat}
start: 0,
limit: 500,
size: 283,
_links: {
self: "host/wiki/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page",
base: "host/wiki",
context: "/wiki"
}
} 

{noformat}

 # Now add the expansion property to the same url and repeat the test:
 ** [host/wiki/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page?limit=500&start=0&expand=ancestors]
 # See that only 200 results are returned and, even if the number of results is lower than the limit, the link to the next page of results is returned:
{noformat}
start: 0,
limit: 500,
size: 200,
_links: {
self: "host/wiki/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page?expand=ancestors",
next: "/rest/api/content/950282/descendant/page?expand=ancestors&limit=500&start=500",
base: "https://theapsgroup.atlassian.net/wiki",
context: "/wiki"
}

{noformat}
fields.summary: REST API - Expansion breaks pagination when calling the endpoint to get 'descendants of type'
Space Tools Tab conditions not receiving proper context

fields.description:
When developing an add-on for confluence and using a "Let's encrypt" certificate from the customer endpoint, an SSL certificate error happens while installing it.

With a Comodo certificate (used for testing only by developers) it works fine. On the audit log at Confluence we only see the SSL error.

"The marketplace can't download your add-on using the provided URL. Provide a publicly accessible URL for your add-on"
fields.summary: SSL error installing add-on

fields.description:
We are working on an add-on that shows a notification to the user with AP.flag. The notification also contains an action that the user can click.

Now when the notification is shown for the first time in the Editor, clicking on the action in the notification will reload the page. The reload will cause our add-on to lose the state it has stored in the JavaScript which leads to a bad user experience.

The notification will be shown again after the reload (because of backend state) and this time it works as desired. Also if the editor page was opened eg. by using the collaborative editor functionality for joining the edit session or copy-pasting the url or refreshed before clicking on the notification action, the notification will work as expected on the first time. On ADG3 version the notification seems to always work as expected.

Repeat:
1. Install the attached simple add-on
2. Go to a page and click 'edit'
3. Click on the 'test' action in the shown notification
-> the page will be reloaded (and notification shown again and now clicking it will work as expected)

Even though the issue happens only in a quite limited use case, it is a major user experience bug for our add-on. As it seems very limited, it seems that it could also be quite easy to fix.
fields.summary: First AP.flag action causes undesired page reload in Editor

{code}
fields.summary: Roadmap macro image download URLs are not in an authorized API scope

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Excerpt Include macro fails to load contents of Table Filter macro.
h3. Environment
This is currently happening for Confluence Cloud both in unicorn and vertigo.

h3 .Steps to Reproduce
# Create page A
# Add a Table Filter Macro into an Excerpt Macro
# Create page B
# Add the Excerpt Include Macro to include excerpt from page A

h3. Expected Results
The excerpt include macro renders the contents with the table filter macro.

h3. Actual Result
The excerpt never loads the Table Filter and throws something like this on the browser console:

{code}
batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&build-number=6452&confluence.table.resizable=true&highlightact…:3400 GET https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/393218/history/4/macro/id/undefined?_=1495806800852 404 ()
{code}

!Excerpt.png|thumbnail! 

!Excerpt Include.png|thumbnail! 

h3. External bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53574
fields.summary: Excerpt Include Macro Fails to Load Table Filter macro.

fields.description:
I've implemented a plugins2 plugin for Confluence Server where I have an event listener where I want to receive events when the user performes a search. But there seems to be a bug wrt SearchEvent. A SearchEvent is fired when performing a quick search, but when searching in the search screen (/dosearchsite.action) no SearchEvent is received.
According to the docs on
https://docs.atlassian.com/ConfluenceServer/javadoc/6.7.2/com/atlassian/confluence/event/events/search/SearchPerformedEvent.html\\ the SearchPerformedEvent should be triggered "whenever a user performs a search through the search screen".
Is this a bug? I've tested with v6.4.2 and v6.7.2.
fields.summary: SearchEvent not triggered by search screen
PageManager movePageAsChild method loses recently added label

fields.description:
The JWT token which is provided for Connect-Addons via the iFrame URL expires after a few minutes, which makes it very hard for cloud applications to do a proper authentication for API calls. Issuing own tokens that last longer is really a bad solution, as each vendor will probably will do it wrong and lead to insecure requests.

Please consider porting over the "Ap.auth.withToken" method from Stride's API to Confluence/Jira Connect addons: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/stride/apis/jsapi/auth/withToken/

Thanks
Tobias
fields.summary: Allow client side JWT token refresh, similar to Stride API

fields.description: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRA-1417
fields.summary: Custom Content Should Be Visible in the Quick Search
Cannot expand details of last updater when calling content REST API

fields.description:
With context parameters that are added to an iframe url that are named something like {{page.id}} or {{page.type}}, the way they are resolved in the connect context is by looking for {{page}}, then by looking for {{id}}, then by looking for the more specific {{page.id}}. This means that when connect addons choose to define a variable {{page}}, it will overwrite all context params relating to page in the url ({{page.id}}, {{page.type}}, {{page.title}}) with the value of the {{page}} variable.   

This task involves flipping this ordering so that it looks for the most specific thing first ({{page.id}}, then {{page}} then {{id}}). This means that using a parameter of {{page}} would be allowable and would not break the other related page parameters.
fields.summary: Resolve context parameters in order from most specific to least specific
back button sometimes causes macro editor to be loaded instead of macro

fields.description:
I have a custom Confluence theme using the spaceview route to override the default space home page. When the theme is activated, the home page is simply blank.

The javascript console has the following error:
{code:javascript}
Uncaught Error: undefined missing connect-host
    at s (batch.js?locale=en-GB:40)
    at batch.js?locale=en-GB:41
s @ batch.js?locale=en-GB:40
(anonymous) @ batch.js?locale=en-GB:41
{code}

The ability to access Space Tools is also lost (as well as Start Watching & Remove from My Spaces).

Note: The same page is working outside of the same (as a general page) and is working as a theme in a Cloud instance without the SPA enabled.
fields.summary: Custom space home page (theme) not appearing with the Single Page Application (SPA) activated
